newsitem.title: CANADA: CWB details Prairie elevator space, railcar unload.
newsitem.headline: CWB details Prairie elevator space, railcar unload.

text.p: Vacant primary elevator space increased to 23 percent in the week ended April 20, while railcar unloads reached 84 percent of their targetted levels, the Canadian Wheat Board said.
The average vacancy in Prairie elvators at 23 percent compared with 21 percent April 15 and 25 percent April 7.
Railway companies attributed delayed grain and oilseed delivery to export ports to severe weather and equipment failure since early January.
Those delays have led to a backlog of vessels on the Pacific Coast and have cost the CWB more than C$20 million in demurrage fines.

Manitoba elevators had the least space available at 17 percent vacant versus 16 the week before, Alberta was next at 22 percent, the same as 22 the prior week. Saskatchewan had most space available at 24 percent versus 21 a week earlier.
Vancouver had 2,939 railcars unloaded, less than the target of 3,300. The prior week saw 2,788 unloads.
Prince Rupert unloaded 1,187 railcars versus the target of 1,300 hope prior week saw 1,362 unloads.
Thunder Bay unloads saw 1,662 railcars unloaded compared to the target of 2,250. The prior week saw 1,224 unloads.
